intro: Gongora oscarrodrigoi, commonly known as the Oscar Rodríguez Gongora, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, often purple or violet-colored flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, thriving in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts. Conservation efforts are crucial due to its vulnerability to habitat loss and climate change.
